messages.message: This section contains the alignments, inferred phylogenetic trees, and detailed results of the evolutionary analysis.
This section contains the recombination plots, and data from which they were derived.
Bootscan analysis performed with window size {1} and step size {2}.
This section contains details of the phylogenetic signal analysis.
Recombination Analyses are only performed for sequences with more than 800 bp.
Alignments with phylogenetic signal higher than 0.9 are considered suitable for the REGA subtype analysis. View the quartets mapped to the triangle.
Recombination Analyses are only performed for sequences with more than 800 bp.

tr.td: What is new in this version.

p.div: The NGS module is a group of files that are needed for NGS analysis and need to be updated from time to time.
All tools that support NGS will use the files from the NGS module with current version checked.
Use Uniprot 50% identity database for viruses and Virus taxonomy database to create dmdb file that will be used by Diamond blast.
Note: the dmdb file is architecture specific and therefor it is recommended to create the database on every server, so click the button.

tr.td: A new version of the tool will be auto installed when it is available in repository.
Allow to send requests with curl
Allow users to surf to the tool url
If true the pan-viral tool will choose this tool version for the virus. Note: there is 1 current version per tool id
Assignment is made if result passes all cut offs
Assignment is made if score is bigger than cut off
Assignment is made if E value is lower than cut off
Assignment is made if best score is this much bigger than second best
Assignment is made if best E value is this much smaller than second best E value
Assignment is made if a sequence with similarity bigger then absolute similarity is found.
Assignment is made if best similarity is this much smaller than second best similarity
Assignment is made if the sequence was found.
All clusters with a score that satisfies all cutoffs are shown.

message.p: blast.xml will be contain one cluster with the first sequence of every genotype.
phylo-.xml if the alignemnt contains only 1 genotype phylo-.xml will contain a cluster for every subtype and 1 phylo major analysis of all this clusters.
blast.xml will contain a cluster per phylo alignemnt.
phylo-.xml if the alignemnt contains only 1 genotype phylo-.xml will contain a cluster for every subtype and 1 phylo major analysis of all this clusters.

blast.fasta used to create blast.xml. blast.fasta sequences names must be the accession number, the same ac number must be part of a sequence in 1 of the alignment files. This will be used to build the clusters and identify regions.
phylo-'cluster-name'.fasta used to create phylo-'cluster-name'.xml the 'cluster name' is used in blast.xml to identify the alignment.

message.div: Alternatively you can provide sequence format regex that contains 3 groups ('genotype', 'subtype', 'accession number')
Examples:
Alternative format ${format}
Error: table variables are specified in config.xml

message.p:
This is a framework to facilitate creation, editing and management of virus typing tools.
Features include:
- GUI for easy creation and management of tools
- Tool validation, with selfscan analysis and comparison with manually assigned sequences (gold standard)
- Linking to a public repository on a remote server (currently http://typingtools.emweb.be/repository/repo-service)

p.div:
Virus (sub)typing tool: For a viral input sequence, this tool identifies the viral (sub)type.
It can be created manually (through the UI) or automatically created from a template.
Template: Contains General UI content for a Virus (sub)typing tool.

Pan-viral tool:The pan-viral typing tool uses blast to cluster long DNA sequences against a comprehensive and curated reference database. If there is a specific (sub)typing tool for the virus on the server, the user can redirect to this tool and perform a full phylogenetic analysis of all the sequences that belong to the viral cluster.
The pan-viral reference database can be auto-generated from ICTV master list.
Remote (published), not installed: Tool data is stored on a remote server and not on local server.
Remote (published), installed: Tool data is stored on a remote server and on local server. The tool can be hosted locally.
Local (unpublished): A tool that was created on local server and is not yet published.

message.div: 1. Select Tools -> Create new tool.
2. Fill in the manifest and local config data and click Save.
3. In the Simple File Editor tab, add all necessary files and then click Save.
Note: display images in resources.xml
4. If you are responsible for the tool you can push it to the central repository (currently http://typingtools.emweb.be/repository/repo-service).
1. Select template in tools table.
2. Select Tools -> Auto create
3. Fill in the manifest.
4. Click Auto create virus tool and upload the alignment fasta file.
5. Some UI parts still need to be changed, but there is UI for that.
1. Select tool in tools table. Select Repository -> Install if it is not already installed.
2. Select Tools -> Create new version
3. Fill in the manifest and local config data and click Save.
4. Edit the relevant files.
5. If you are responsible for the tool you can push it to the central repository (currently http://typingtools.emweb.be/repository/repo-service).
message.h4: Add NGS analysis option to your tool
message.div: NGS Analysis will look for a few place holders if they can be filled the analysis is enabled. (This can change in the near future)
The placeholders are:
Need to be place in <message id="start-form">: $${start-form.ngs-widget}
Need to be place in <message id="job-overview-form">: $${ngs-results}
You can copy all that from resurces.xml of pan-viral 3.1 tool (from public repository).

NGS Analysis has many depandances: most are configured in Global config, but some need to be updated from time to time (like diamond blast database) for this ones we created the NGS module. Make sure to import/ install this module in to your Tools Table.
1. Add the image files using the Simple File Editor tab.
2. Add to resources.xml:

messages.message: Coverage map: alignment of the reads against the chosen reference sequence.
